dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Picture an airport like a beating heart, and right now, the heart of Uralsk is pumping out about 50 flights every single week.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, that's actually a pretty steady flow for a regional hub. And it's interesting, the ownership structure there—51 percent Kazakh investors, 49 percent foreign.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly, with Oral Airport Holding LLP taking over operations since February of last year.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And they're not just maintaining things; they're looking at expanding, like increasing flights to high-demand domestic spots, Astana and Almaty.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right, but they did have to cut one international route—the Uralsk to Phuket flight got canceled back on January 1st because of low demand.
